page.title: 04MIDDRIDGE, CO. DURHAM.
page.content: {Middridge}is situated between {Shildon}and{Newton Aycliffe}and is on a bus route between these towns. The village of{Middridge}has a population of 298 people. Most of the people live in privately owned houses. The village is very small and has only one shop and post office, and an inn called{The Bay Horse.} Across the village green is a war memorial commemorating those villagers who were killed during the First World War (1914-1918). At the bottom of the main street there is a church hall which was once the village school, there being no church or chapel in{ {Middridge.} Many of the older houses have been modernised and newer detached houses built at prices ranging from Â£37,000 to Â£50,000.
